Test My Fire

Introduction to Test My Fire

Updated June 25, 2020

#Fiction   #Novel   #Mystery & Suspense   #Thriller

Description

(Her) He killed my parents, not to mention dozens of other people. He‚Äôs only known by the Phantom but I will uncover his identity and make him pay. I‚Äôm good at this game and I‚Äôll play it till I die. The Phantom thinks he‚Äôs good, but he hasn‚Äôt met me yet. I play with fire, live in it really. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm called the Phoenix Fox. The fire may burn me, but I will extinguish it before it can kill me.

(Him) Yes, I‚Äôm a killer and I‚Äôm good at it. Hundreds have tried to find me, none have succeeded and that‚Äôs the way I like it. I wasn‚Äôt named ‚ÄúThe Phantom‚Äô‚Äô for nothing. Those who have gotten close I‚Äôve gotten rid of, all except the cunning little spy known as the Phoenix Fox. She was at my brother‚Äôs party and now she‚Äôs in my head. I should kill her, I really should. She‚Äôs gotten too close and she knows it. She keeps toying with me, jumping in and out of the crossfire. She‚Äôs good at the game, but I‚Äôm better. The clock is ticking and I‚Äôm good at waiting. I know she‚Äôll come to me, they always do. And when she does, I‚Äôll take care of her too. Here little fox, come test my fire.

Note: This was a draft that I found in one of my notebooks. I started editing it the same day I started writing ‚ÄúKidnapped and Afraid.‚Äù

Written by Bravisha Skietano

I'm an eighteen-year-old, homeschooled, Christian student who is struggling to stay motivated and finish things. I love Jesus, pretty much any yarn crafts (crochet, knitting, macrame, been there done that), reading, writing, horses, developing websites (new at that), FOSS, and anything Linux (I'm not a complete tech geek but I definitely see myself getting there blush).

I'm very social, which isn't a very good thing since I trust people too easily wink, but I'm getting better. I open my mouth a lot before thinking, but as I said, I'm getting better. I procrastinate way too much but prayerfully I will learn some self-control and apply it everywhere in my life (starting with my mouthüòã).
